page.title: 01WELCOME TO WILTSHIRE.
page.content: INTRODUCTION: Our survey area covers an agricultural and historical part of the chalk down- lands of Wiltshire. Around the area we find numerous Barrows and Tumulis with evidence of earthworks from bygone days. Wooded clumps are seen dotted around and these are inhabited by many wild animals, birds and plants. The river Till runs through a lowland valley, and the surrounding arable farmland is used for many different types of crop and general grazing for sheep and cattle. During past years a number of fields close to the Stonehenge Monument had been taken over for illegal pop festivals. Plans are now in hand for a study centre. Tourists from all over the world visit the area. General weather conditions prevail. The climate varies from -10C in Winter to +80C in Summer.
